parameters.description: A list of matchers to filter alerts by
parameters.name: matchers

parameters.description: A list of receivers to filter alerts by
parameters.name: receivers

parameters.description: A list of matchers to filter alerts by
parameters.name: matchers

parameters.description: A list of receivers to filter alerts by
parameters.name: receivers

delete.description: deletes the Alerting config for a tenant

parameters.description: Namespace name to apply perms to
parameters.name: Namespace

get.description: gets the evaluation statuses of all rules

post.description: Creates or updates a rule group

Alert.title: Alert has info for an alert.

AlertDiscovery.title: AlertDiscovery has info for all active alerts.

instances.description:
Instances is an array of arrow encoded dataframes
each frame has a single row, and a column for each instance (alert identified by unique labels) with a boolean value (firing/not firing)

AlertQuery.title: AlertQuery represents a single query associated with an alert definition.

model.description: JSON is the raw JSON query and includes the above properties as well as custom properties.

queryType.description:
QueryType is an optional identifier for the type of query.
It can be used to distinguish different types of queries.

refId.description: RefID is the unique identifier of the query, set by the frontend call.

receivers.description: Override with our superset receiver type

name.description: A unique identifier for this receiver.

BasicAuth.title: BasicAuth contains basic HTTP authentication credentials.

Config.title: Config is the top-level configuration for Alertmanager's config files.

DateTime.description:
DateTime is a time but it serializes to ISO8601 format with millis
It knows how to read 3 different variations of a RFC3339 date time.
Most APIs we encounter want either millisecond or second precision times.
This just tries to make it worry-free.

Duration.title: Duration is a type used for marshalling durations.

ErrorType.title: ErrorType models the different API error types.

ExtendedUpsertAlertDefinitionCommand.description:
ExtendedUpsertAlertDefinitionCommand extends UpsertAlertDefinitionCommand
with properties of grafana dashboard alerts

condition.description: Condition is the refID of the query or expression to be evaluated

data.description: Data is an array of the queries and expressions

uid.description: UID is set only for existing definitions

GlobalConfig.description:
GlobalConfig defines configuration parameters that are valid globally
unless overwritten.

BearerTokenFile.description: The bearer token file for the targets.

InhibitRule.description:
InhibitRule defines an inhibition rule that mutes alerts that match the
target labels if an alert matching the source labels exists.
Both alerts have to have a set of labels being equal.

source_match.description:
SourceMatch defines a set of labels that have to equal the given
value for source alerts. Deprecated. Remove before v1.0 release.

target_match.description:
TargetMatch defines a set of labels that have to equal the given
value for target alerts. Deprecated. Remove before v1.0 release.

Label.title: Label is a key/value pair of strings.

LabelName.description:
A LabelName is a key for a LabelSet or Metric.  It has a value associated
therewith.

LabelNames.title: LabelNames is a sortable LabelName slice. In implements sort.Interface.

Labels.description:
Labels is a sorted set of labels. Order has to be guaranteed upon
instantiation.

datasourceUid.description: DatasourceUID is required if the query will be sent to grafana to be executed

MatchRegexps.title: MatchRegexps represents a map of Regexp.

MatchType.title: MatchType is an enum for label matching types.

Matcher.title: Matcher models the matching of a label.

Matchers.description:
Matchers is a slice of Matchers that is sortable, implements Stringer, and
provides a Matches method to match a LabelSet against all Matchers in the
slice. Note that some users of Matchers might require it to be sorted.

NotifierConfig.title: NotifierConfig contains base options common across all notifier configurations.

id.description: One of those 3 should be filled.

Point.title: Point represents a single data point for a given timestamp.

Receiver.title: Receiver configuration provides configuration on how to contact a receiver.

name.description: A unique identifier for this receiver.

Regexp.description:
A Regexp is safe for concurrent use by multiple goroutines,
except for configuration methods, such as Longest.
Regexp.title: Regexp is the representation of a compiled regular expression.

RelativeTimeRange.description:
RelativeTimeRange is the per query start and end time
for requests.

Route.title: A Route is a node that contains definitions of how to handle alerts.

rules.description:
In order to preserve rule ordering, while exposing type (alerting or recording)
specific properties, both alerting and recording rules are exposed in the
same array.

RuleType.title: RuleType models the type of a rule.

Sample.title: Sample is a single sample belonging to a metric.

Secret.title: Secret special type for storing secrets.

SecretURL.title: SecretURL is a URL that must not be revealed on marshaling.

SecureJsonData.description:
SecureJsonData is used to store encrypted data (for example in data_source table). Only values are separately
encrypted.

SlackAction.title: SlackAction configures a single Slack action that is sent with each notification.

SlackConfirmationField.description:
SlackConfirmationField protect users from destructive actions or particularly distinguished decisions
by asking them to confirm their button click one more time.
See https://api.slack.com/docs/interactive-message-field-guide#confirmation_fields for more information.

SlackField.description:
Each field must contain a title, value, and optionally, a boolean value to indicate if the field
is short enough to be displayed next to other fields designated as short.
See https://api.slack.com/docs/message-attachments#fields for more information.
SlackField.title: SlackField configures a single Slack field that is sent with each notification.

TLSConfig.title: TLSConfig configures the options for TLS connections.

CAFile.description: The CA cert to use for the targets.

CertFile.description: The client cert file for the targets.

KeyFile.description: The client key file for the targets.

ServerName.description: Used to verify the hostname for the targets.

URL.description:
The general form represented is:

[scheme:][//[userinfo@]host][/]path[?query][#fragment]

URLs that do not start with a slash after the scheme are interpreted as:

scheme:opaque[?query][#fragment]

Note that the Path field is stored in decoded form: /%47%6f%2f becomes /Go/.
A consequence is that it is impossible to tell which slashes in the Path were
slashes in the raw URL and which were %2f. This distinction is rarely important,
but when it is, the code should use RawPath, an optional field which only gets
set if the default encoding is different from Path.

URL's String method uses the EscapedPath method to obtain the path. See the
EscapedPath method for more details.
URL.title: A URL represents a parsed URL (technically, a URI reference).

UpsertAlertDefinitionCommand.title: UpsertAlertDefinitionCommand is copy of the unexported struct:

condition.description: Condition is the refID of the query or expression to be evaluated

data.description: Data is an array of the queries and expressions

uid.description: UID is set only for existing definitions

Userinfo.description:
The Userinfo type is an immutable encapsulation of username and
password details for a URL. An existing Userinfo value is guaranteed
to have a username set (potentially empty, as allowed by RFC 2396),
and optionally a password.

Vector.description:
Vector is basically only an alias for model.Samples, but the
contract is that in a Vector, all Samples have the same timestamp.

WebhookConfig.title: WebhookConfig configures notifications via a generic webhook.

max_alerts.description:
MaxAlerts is the maximum number of alerts to be sent per webhook message.
Alerts exceeding this threshold will be truncated. Setting this to 0
allows an unlimited number of alerts.

labels.description: The custom marshaling for labels.Labels ends up doing this anyways.
labels.title: override the labels type with a map for generation.
